alert.note: Alert for McIntosh; Okfuskee (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued September 23 at 3:51PM CDT until September 23 at 11:00PM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 430 PM CDT FOR WESTERN MCINTOSH...SOUTH CENTRAL OKMULGEE AND SOUTHEASTERN OKFUSKEE COUNTIES... At 348 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Henryetta, moving east at 15 mph. THIS IS A DESTRUCTIVE STORM FOR Henryetta. HAZARD...Baseball size hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters. At 348 pm, golfball size hail and estimated 70 mph wind gusts were reported just west of Henryetta. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be severely injured. Expect shattered windows, extensive damage to roofs, siding, and vehicles. Locations in or near the path include... Henryetta... Dewar... Hoffman... Bryant... Pierce... This includes Interstate 40 in Oklahoma between mile markers 232 and 253. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...DESTRUCTIVE HAIL THREAT...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...2.75 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: Prepare immediately for large hail and damaging winds. People outside should move to a shelter, inside a strong building and away from windows.
